thread.title: Steelers outlast the Cardinals: Storylines and Takeaways
thread.title_full: Steelers outlast the Cardinals: Storylines and Takeaways

title: Steelers outlast the Cardinals: Storylines and Takeaways
text:
Steelers outlast the Cardinals: Storylines and Takeaways The Steelers took advantage of the Cardinals miscues on Sunday. Post to Facebook Steelers outlast the Cardinals: Storylines and Takeaways The Steelers took advantage of the Cardinals miscues on Sunday.   12news.com: http://12ne.ws/1RQhPv8   Join the Conversation To   Steelers outlast the Cardinals: Storylines and Takeaways Robby Baker , 12 Sports 2:24 p.m. MST October 18, 2015 Bruce Cooper breaks down the Cardinals loss. KPNX The Steelers took advantage of the Cardinals miscues on Sunday. Oct 18, 2015; Pittsburgh, PA, USA; Arizona Cardinals wide receiver John Brown (12) misses a pass in the endzone against the Pittsburgh Steelers during the first half at Heinz Field. Mandatory Credit: Jason Bridge-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Jason Bridge-USA TODAY Sports) 4 CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Arizona Cardinals fell to 4-2 on the season as the Pittsburgh Steelers beat Arizona 25-13 on Sunday. 
Wasted Opportunities 
The Arizona Cardinals were controlling this game in the first half. 
The Cardinals stymied Michael Vick and were moving the ball on the Steelers defense, they just couldn't find the end zone. 
They let the Steelers hang around, and it proved costly. 
Once Pittsburgh put Landry Jones in the game, it was game over. Jones finished the game 8-12 with 168 yards passing. He threw for two touchdowns and the Steelers scored on every possession after he entered the game.
